p: The linear relationships between the external drivers and Arctic sea-ice coverage do not only hold during summer, but have been shown to hold for all months, both for temperature [ 36] and for cumulative CO 2 emissions [ 37]. For the linear regression against CO 2, R 2 values range between 0.75 and 0.92 for every month of the year over the period 1953â€“2017 [ 37]. This suggests that the majority of the ice loss across all seasons can directly be explained by the anthropogenic release of CO 2.
